# Minimal Design Kit (MDK) - LLM Overview

> **Purpose**: AI-friendly CSS decision-making framework for consistent, reason-driven design
> **Philosophy**: "No CSS Without Reason" - Every design choice must answer WHY

---

## Quick Start

**What is MDK?**
A CSS abstraction system that reduces infinite CSS combinations to ~100 meaningful choices by asking "WHY" before "HOW".

**Core Innovation**
- Traditional: 16M colors × infinite spacing × infinite sizing = ∞ choices → inconsistency
- MDK: 13 categories × 5-20 semantic options each = ~100 choices → AI-inferrable design

---

## Architecture Overview

### 1. 3-Tier Intent System
The foundational pattern for all MDK components:

```
Tier 1: Primitive (Container Component)
   ↓
Tier 2: Intent (Purpose/Why - The "reason")
   ↓
Tier 3: Component (Implementation/How - The "solution")
```

**API Pattern**: `Primitive.{Intent}.{Component}`

**Example**:
```tsx
<Field name="email">
  {/* Intent: Guidance - Why? User needs to know what to enter */}
  <Field.Guidance label="Email" description="For login" />

  {/* Intent: Control - Why? User needs input mechanism */}
  <Field.Control><Input /></Field.Control>

  {/* Intent: Validation - Why? Data must be correct */}
  <Field.Validation schema={emailSchema} />
</Field>
```

---

## 13 CSS Abstraction Categories

All CSS properties map to exactly one of these categories, each with a clear WHY:

### Level 1: Existence
1. **Content Flow** - "Should this be displayed?" (display, visibility, clip-path)
2. **Sizing** - "How much space should this occupy?" (width, height, flex)

### Level 2: Structure
3. **Layout** - "How to organize internal elements?" (flexbox, grid, gap, padding)
4. **Spacing** - "What relationship with other elements?" (margin)
5. **Overlay** - "Should this float above?" (position: absolute/fixed, z-index)
6. **Anchor** - "Should this stick when scrolling?" (position: sticky)
7. **Offset** - "Needs position adjustment?" (position: relative, top/left)

### Level 3: Expression
8. **Surface** - "How to distinguish visually?" (background, border, radius, shadow)
9. **Typography** - "How should text be read?" (font-size, line-height, weight)
10. **Visual Effects** - "What feeling to convey?" (opacity, filter, blur)

### Level 4: Response
11. **Interaction** - "How do users interact?" (cursor, pointer-events, user-select)
12. **State** - "How to react to interaction?" (:hover, :active, .selected)
13. **Motion** - "How to show change?" (transition, animation, transform)

**Reduction**: Infinite CSS combinations → ~100 semantic choices (99.999% reduction)

## Core Components

### Frame
Universal layout primitive with props-based API:
```tsx
<Frame
  surface="raised"      // Surface category
  layout="stack.content" // Layout category
  p={4}                 // Spacing
  rounded="md"          // Surface
  w="sidebar"           // Sizing
/>
```

### Text System
- **Text**: Base text component with variants
- **Prose**: Document typography (h1-h4, body, caption)
- **Context-aware**: Card.Title, Field.Label, Table.Cell, Menu.Item

### Action
Button/action component with state and feedback:
```tsx
<Action
  icon={Icon}
  variant="primary"     // Surface category
  motion="press.shrink" // Motion category
/>
```

### Field
Input component with scrubbing support and validation

## Design Token System

Located in `src/design-system/token/`:
- `tokens.1tier.css` - Base tier tokens
- `tokens.palette.css` - Color palette
- `tokens.components.css` - Component-specific tokens
- `tokens.themes.css` - Light/dark themes
- `tokens.experiences.css` - Experience-level tokens
- `tokens.typography.css` - Typography scale
- `tokens.layout.css` - Layout tokens

**Key Scales**:
- Spacing: `--space-0` (0px) to `--space-16` (128px)
- Sizing: `--size-3` (12px) to `--size-300` (1200px)
- Surfaces: base, sunken, raised, overlay, primary, selected
- Typography: 6 prose levels (h1: 80px → caption: 14px)

## Key Sizing Decisions (WHY-based)

**40px** - Minimum touch target (iOS/Android ergonomics)
**240px** - Standard sidebar (text label + icon comfortable width)
**320px** - Minimum mobile viewport
**680px** - Optimal reading width (50-75 chars/line, typography theory)
**1200px** - Maximum content width (eye fatigue limit)

## API Patterns

### Prop-Based Design
```tsx
// Token-driven props instead of className
<Frame
  surface="raised"      // → background, border, shadow
  layout="stack.section" // → flex, gap, padding
  w="content"           // → 680px, max-width: 100%
  rounded="md"          // → border-radius: 6px
/>
```

### Progressive Enhancement (3 Levels)
```tsx
// Level 1: Simple (Intent hidden)
<Field name="email" label="Email" validate={schema}>
  <Input />
</Field>

// Level 2: Structured (Intent groups visible)
<Field name="email">
  <Field.Guidance label="Email" />
  <Field.Validation schema={schema} />
  <Field.Control><Input /></Field.Control>
</Field>

// Level 3: Explicit (Full Intent + Component control)
<Field name="email">
  <Field.Guidance>
    <Field.Label>Email</Field.Label>
    <Field.Description>Login credentials</Field.Description>
  </Field.Guidance>
  <Field.Control><CustomInput /></Field.Control>
  <Field.Validation><Field.Schema value={schema} /></Field.Validation>
  <Field.Feedback><Field.Error /></Field.Feedback>
</Field>
```

---

## Key Principles

1. **Intent Visibility** - API structure reveals WHY components exist
2. **Progressive Enhancement** - Start simple, add complexity as needed
3. **Default Composition** - Auto-render sensible defaults, allow overrides
4. **Context Inheritance** - Child components inherit parent Intent contexts
5. **Intent Independence** - Each Intent works standalone, order-agnostic

## For AI Assistants

When working with this codebase:

1. **Always ask WHY first** - Before choosing a CSS value, identify the intent
2. **Use semantic tokens** - `w="sidebar"` not `w={240}`
3. **Leverage categories** - Map CSS properties to the 13 categories
4. **Follow 3-Tier structure** - Primitive → Intent → Component
5. **Reason over memorization** - Don't memorize values, understand WHY they exist

**Example thought process**:
```
Need: Button component
WHY: Primary action → surface="primary"
WHY: Clickable area → h="action" (48px)
WHY: Respond to press → motion="press.shrink"
Result: Consistent, reason-driven button
```
